required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of NPH Insulin and Insulin Detemir in Children and Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: An Efficacy and Safety Comparison of Insulin Detemir vs. NPH Insulin in Children and Adolescents Diagnosed With Type 1 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock:
This trial is conducted in Europe.
The aim of this research is to compare the efficacy and safety of treatment with NPH insulin and insulin detemir. You will be treated with either insulin detemir or NPH insulin once or twice daily as basal insulin. Additionally you will receive insulin aspart as bolus insulin

primary_outcome.description: Glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) measured after 52 weeks of treatment and analysed by central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects reporting adverse events during the trial (from week -2 to week 52). For details, please refer to the adverse events section.
Observed insulin antibody values for insulin detemir specific antibodies, insulin aspart specific antibodies and insulin detemir/insulin aspart cross-reacting antibodies.

intervention.description: s.c. injection, once or twice daily.
s.c. injection, once or twice daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Insulin detemir naive
- Type 1 diabetes for at least 12 months
- HbA1c lesser than or equal to 11.0%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant concomitant diseases

address.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

location_countries.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

results_reference.citation: Thalange N, Bereket A, Larsen J, Hiort LC, Peterkova V. Treatment with insulin detemir or NPH insulin in children aged 2-5 yr with type 1 diabetes mellitus. Pediatr Diabetes. 2011 Nov;12(7):632-41. doi: 10.1111/j.1399-5448.2010.00750.x. Epub 2011 Mar 21.

Thalange N, Bereket A, Larsen J, Hiort LC, Peterkova V. Insulin analogues in children with Type 1 diabetes: a 52-week randomized clinical trial. Diabet Med. 2013 Feb;30(2):216-25. doi: 10.1111/dme.12041.

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 35 centres in 11 countries.

group.title: Insulin Detemir
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir dose injected subcutaneously once daily (evening) or twice daily (morning and evening) + insulin aspart with larger meals

group.title: NPH Insulin
group.description: Individually adjusted NPH insulin dose injected subcutaneously once daily (evening) or twice daily (morning and evening) + insulin aspart with larger meals

participants_list.participants: One subject withdrew before receiving study drug, and thus not included in the full analysis set.

outcome.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
outcome.description: Glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) measured after 52 weeks of treatment and analysed by central laboratory.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) is defined as all randomised subjects exposed to at least one dose of trial product with a postbaseline observation, classified according to randomised treatment.

group.title: Insulin Detemir
group.description: Individually adjusted insulin detemir dose injected subcutaneously once daily (evening) or twice daily (morning and evening) + insulin aspart with larger meals

measure.title: Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
measure.description: Glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) measured after 52 weeks of treatment and analysed by central laboratory.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) is defined as all randomised subjects exposed to at least one dose of trial product with a postbaseline observation, classified according to randomised treatment.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis for the non-inferiority test was that the mean HbA1c with insulin detemir was greater than or equal to the mean HbA1c with NPH insulin plus 0.4%. A sample size of 344 subjects, in total, with a drop-out rate of 20 percent would yield 274 subjects for evaluation of HbA1c. This would give 85 percent power to detect a difference in means of HbA1c of 0.4 percentage points assuming that the standard deviation was 1.1 using a two-sided t-test with a 0.05 significance level.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Adverse Events
outcome.description: Number of subjects reporting adverse events during the trial (from week -2 to week 52). For details, please refer to the adverse events section.
outcome.population: Safety analysis set (SAS): all randomised subjects exposed to at least one dose of trial product, classified according to actual treatment.

outcome.title: Observed Insulin Antibody Values
outcome.description: Observed insulin antibody values for insulin detemir specific antibodies, insulin aspart specific antibodies and insulin detemir/insulin aspart cross-reacting antibodies.
outcome.population: Safety analysis set (SAS): All randomised subjects exposed to at least one dose of trial product, classified according to actual treatment. In some cases, antibody samples were taken earlier than required. These results were not included. A shipment of antibody samples was lost during transportation, and thus these antibody data were missing.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from week 0 to week 52.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk acknowledges the Investigator‚Äôs right to publish the entire results of the trial. Any such scientific paper, presentation, communication or other information concerning the investigation described in this protocol, must be submitted in writing to Novo Nordisk Trial Manager prior to submission for publication/presentation for comments. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the manuscript.
